T_5:
Mechanism for peripheral neuropathy after chemotherapy with vincristine
Answer I came up with:
There are many chemotherapy agents that cause peripheral neuropathy but vincristine most commonly causes this. Neuropathy is thought to result due to vincristine's effect of impairing axonal transport of mitochondria such that normal oxidative metabolism is not maintained in the nerve terminal. Inhibition of the transport of neurofilaments also plays a role in the development of distal axonal damage.
